column5: message

Let Dependabot always handle security updates (#531)

Dependabot doesn't currently create PRs for security updates if they are
indirect production (runtime) dependencies (not direct dependencies of
the gem, but dependencies of a runtime dependency). Like nokogiri here.

Since Github still creates security alerts for those, I'd like
dependabot to handle these automatically too.

My guess is that dependabot classifies dependency types like this:

    ▾ all
    ├── ▾ direct
    │   ├── production
    │   └── development
    └── indirect

And not like this as I thought:

    ▾ all
    ├── ▾ production
    │   ├── direct
    │   └── indirect
    └── ▾ development
        ├── direct
        └── indirect

So specifying `type: production` won't suffice for this type of
dependencies. Let's try with `type: all`.
Use dependabot for runtime security updates (#530)
Switch main Gemfile to Rails 6 (#529)
bin/rake bundle[update,rails]

Merge pull request #470 from javierjulio/update-test-run-random

Update test to run in random order

Move redirect cases into its own test to fix random failures

These tests were causing others to fail at random when they were all in the same test case. That's why we changed the test order to run them in order rather than the new default of random. The issue is that in these test cases the controller class is modified to define explicit actions which affect other test cases where those are expected to be there. I couldn't figure out how to undo that so I split these up and used a different named controller so we can specify explicit actions whereas the other test assumes the default.
Remove unncessary stub call that causes failure

Merge pull request #459 from javierjulio/fix-test-warnings

Fix warnings from running the test suite

Remove global test suite routes

These are now defined in each test case where only the necessary routes are drawn for each specific test. This way we also no longer rely on dynamic segments which are deprecated in newer versions of Rails.
Add note to fix test so it runs in random order
Update each test to define the routes it requires

Add `draw_routes` and `clear_routes` helper methods

We want each test to setup only the routes and resources it requires rather than have it be global for the entire test suite. Also we can't rely on dynamic segments anymore with newer versions of Rails so its best we have explicit routes.
Fix `parent` and `parent?` warnings

Rename test class to be unique so it now runs

This duplicate test class was introduced in https://github.com/activeadmin/inherited_resources/commit/5c18cf12 but it was emitting a warning of:

```
defaults_test.rb:190: warning: method redefined; discarding old test_that_it_picked_the_camelcased_model
defaults_test.rb:171: warning: previous definition of test_that_it_picked_the_camelcased_model was here
```

This means that the test case wasn't running since it was overridden but now it is and it passes.

Fix polymorphic warning to ensure instance variable is defined

The test case `test_parent_as_instance_variable_on_index_when_method_overwritten` in `polymorphic_test.rb` was emitting the following warning:

```
lib/inherited_resources/polymorphic_helpers.rb:123: warning: instance variable @user not initialized
```

This is easy to resolve, as we just need to ensure the instance variable is defined before we attempt to retrieve it.

Rename and fix test case

This test case too was not running because there is another test case with the same name in this file. That issue was introduced in: https://github.com/activeadmin/inherited_resources/commit/3a4894e7#diff-f18627fee27eba459b80262e6a0f1278

If you search for "test_assigns_country_and_state_and_city_on_create" you'll see it listed twice in that file.

Once the test case name is unique, it runs but it will fail with an error of:

```
NoMethodError: undefined method `all' for City:Class
```

I wasn't sure how to correct this but I searched the repository for "undefined method all" and on this page: https://github.com/activeadmin/inherited_resources/search?q=undefined+method+all&type=Issues I found the PR: https://github.com/activeadmin/inherited_resources/pull/116 I then noticed other tests for get requests on index actions that used `expects(:scoped)` instead. Exact same style setup but this was just wrong and since it wasn't running we didn't know.

Rename test case to be unique so it runs

This redirect test case is testing the create action, not update. Another same test case in this file tests the update action so this is renamed to be correct. More importantly now it actually runs. Since it was a duplicate, this test case was never running.

Fix undefined instance variable @parent_type warning

When running the test suite, the following warning appears *many* times:

```
warning: instance variable @parent_type not initialized
```

We have to wrap both in conditionals because if you review `symbols_for_association_chain` carefully it may not set the instance variable leaving it in a still undefined state. In case it is, we fall on the default behavior of returning nil. This is passes all the tests while removing all warnings for this variable.
Replace deprecated `Fixnum` with `Integer` instead

Merge pull request #467 from javierjulio/update-tests

General updates to test cases
Inline `request_params` method

Rename duplicate Professor test data class to fix warning

The set of test cases here was introduced in https://github.com/activeadmin/inherited_resources/commit/903d1e49#diff-c66cdb7c833309c1697b40c1f6eb9e87R76

The issue is that the Professor class is also defined in the `customized_belongs_to_test.rb` file so when running the full test suite you'll see the following 2 warnings:

```
defaults_test.rb:77: warning: method redefined; discarding old human_name
customized_belongs_to_test.rb:7: warning: previous definition of human_name was here
```

Since the commit introduced a mixture of painter/professor and its own views, I think it was best to edit these to be unique to not conflict with test case in `customized_belongs_to_test.rb` that has been around a lot longer.

I went with the Lecturer since while Einstein was a professor he was also a lecturer. I updated any mixed professor/painter instances to just be lecturer instead so its consistent. This now resolves those 2 warnings.

Add request params for single resource calls

Most tests cases that work with a single resource specify request params with an id but not all. As we move to defining explicit routes/resources, we need to be consistent and specify request params across the board.
Fix indentation on test case

Update request_params with options

We need this for some tests that pass `format: :js` for example but are for single resources (have an id). We need to support this while still working with Rails 4.

Remove duplicate test case

This was a duplicate test case introduced in PR and commit: https://github.com/activeadmin/inherited_resources/pull/258/files#diff-62c651579bf983dfc4dc2a48c50a3440R470

If you expand the lines on that file and go all the way to around 750 or so and you'll see the same test case name. That version of the test case has additional checks in the end but is the same as this one (which never ran because of the duplicate name). The only difference is the one running has stubs for `persisted?` on table and dish right after the intialization of each.

Merge pull request #454 from activeadmin/gemfile_management

Gemfile management

Revert "Remove deployment bundler arg"

This reverts commit ea2e085f7b5b9d8f5fa9add33f7d6be402eee6e9.

I think the reason I needed this was that my initial patch was
incorrect.

Move lock file removal to before_install

So that it's run before bundle install. We can also remove back the
default `script:` as it was before.
Remove deployment bundler arg

Test against latest dependencies in CI

This is not very good for contributors, since they might get a failing
build when it's not their fault and build passes locally, but it's good
for discovering incompatibilities in latest dependencies.

We decided to go for the latter.

Add lockfiles to the repo

So the resulting environment for a given Gemfile is deterministic.

Move latest Gemfile to repo root

So that contributors have an initial working bundle.

Merge pull request #440 from fernandomm/action-controller-parameters-fix

Fix URL helpers not working with ActionController::Parameters
Remove check to verify if ActionController::Parameters is defined
Apply change requested in the PR review

Fix URL helpers not working with ActionController::Parameters

Helpers like collection_url/path use extract_options! which won't work with ActionController::Parameters since it isn't a hash.

This PR adds a check and transform ActionController::Parameters to a hash if necessary, making URL helpers behave like the Rails ones when parameter is a ActionController::Parameters object.

Allow for nesting of singleton belong_to's.

Note that
    class ThingAController < InheritedResource::Base
        belongs_to :thing_b, :singleton => true
    end
used to mean there was only one ThingA (so resource_path == /thing_bs/123/thing_a), while it now means there is only one ThingB (so resource_path == /thing_b/thing_as/123)

To specify there is only one ThingA, you'll need
    defaults :singleton => true

Readme updated to include namespaced controllers support

Resource class priority system for namespaced controllers

Implemented a resource class priority system for namespaced
controllers, for instance if you got a controller called:
  Admin::GroupController

First priority for the resource will be the namespaced
model, i.e.:
  Admin::Group

Second priority for the resource is the camelcased model,
i.e.:
  AdminGroup

Otherwise it will use the controller's name, or fail with
a TypeError, i.e.:
  Group

Request parameters fetched independently of instance name

In #build_reaouce and #update the params were found by instance_name,
which required the instance name to have the same name as the controller
(including namespaces). This is no longer the case, it is now
automatically found from the controller's name, thus users are free to
modify the instance name, furthermore controller namespaces is much better
supported.

  Before: FileVersion => Fileversion
  After: FileVersion => File version

avoiding common `classify` bug with singular nouns

Most singular nouns can be `classify`'d just fine but anything
that ends in 's' in the singular form will be improperly transformed.

If a resource is named :business the previous code would attempt:

   :business.to_s.classify.constantize # => Unknown Constant 'Busines'

This patch allows:

   :business.to_s.pluralize.classify.constantize # => Business

adding support for :if and :unless scope options

This provides the same functionality as the :if and :unless behavior
on before_filters and after_filters.  A scope will be applied if :if
evaluates to true and will be skipped if :unless evaluates to true.

Particularly helpful for situations like the following:

  has_scope :not_deleted, :default => true, :unless => :is_admin?

Accepts:
  - Strings
  - Procs
  - Symbol method names

Allow belongs_to to have a common options[:finder]

So you can have:

   class CommentsController < InheritedResources::Base
     belongs_to :task, :message, :polymorphic => true, :finder => :find_by_title
   end

And you can use this urls:

/tasks/:task_title/comments
/messages/:message_title/comments
